review_blob: Clementine pours an expected light orange-gold and has the citrus notes you'd expect to smell and taste. The flavor is light and fruity, and the aftertaste is tart. Overall, a good beer.

I dont think theres anything singularly outstanding about this beer, but it stands as a better-than-average kind of drink as well. Its smooth and pours a nice amber color and is a good alternative to some other "safe" beer you may drink just to have one in your hand, but its not particularly memorable.
Bourbon Barrel Quad tastes a lot more like a traditional quad than it does anything aged in bourbon barrels. The sweeter cherry notes are evident and the beer is overall very drinkable.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Bourbon Barrel Quad

review_blob: This smells of something sweet between fruit and toffee; its taste is smooth and not overpowering and it carries a strong aftertaste.

Jai Alai is a uniquely robust IPA in that it's got the typical piney scent and taste, but it feels so full bodied that I feel like I'm drinking a heavier beer than I am. It's smooth yet it's somewhat overpowering. It's a very good beer.
beer_name: Cigar City Jai Alai India Pale Ale

review_blob: Troeganator is a special brew. It pours a beautiful dark amber color with a nice small head. I don't detect much by way of scent, which is odd, but this beer is smooth from start to finish. Really, really clean.

Little Sumpin Sumpin smells of floral hops with a strong piney overtone. Its taste is a bit bitter, and not reminiscent of most other wheat beers, but its not undrinkable, either. I dont get the sweet notes from it that other reviewers have; what I smelled and tasted were much more floral.
beer_name: Lagunitas A Little Sumpin Sumpin Ale

review_blob: My excitement for this beer was eclipsed by its mediocrity. At the end of the day, theres not even a hint of anything related to tequila; all you have is a very bland wheat beer from an underwhelming brewery.

The beauty in this beer is both in its color (it pours a lovely shade of reddish brown) and in its smooth finish. The label says its brewed with raisins, and you can smell and taste the presence of raisins throughout. Its a strong beer. Its got just the faintest bitterness to it in its aftertaste, but its very smooth overall.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Gift of the Maggi pours a beautiful shade of reddish brown and tastes mildly fruity with a dry aftertaste. I find it pairs well with a spicier food, but I think it'll pair with the typical foods Belgians pair well with as well (cheeses, salty meats, etc.) This is a great beer from a great brewery.
beer_name: Lost Abbey Gift of the Magi

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Not a bad beer. I tend to really like Hefeweizens, but this doesnt strike me as a great hefe or even as something that could really be called a hefe at all. Drink something else if thats what youre looking for specifically, but Magic Hat tends to do silly things a lot and I think their beer has kind of fallen off in the last few years as a result.

This beer is okay! It doesnt have much to offer in terms of smell or appearance, but its light enough that its not a chore to drink. Its a little bitter but it isnt something that you want to pour down the sink.

This is everything I hoped it would be when I bought it. Theres a dryness to it that you associate with hoppy IPAs, but its tart and like a sour. The blood orange really makes it light and drinkable without taking away from the IPA part of its taste.
beer_name: Funky Buddha More Moro Blood Orange IPA

review_blob: Hopstate NY is good, but is clearly very different from what Ommegangs fans have come to expect. Its dry and it tastes like a good American pale ale, similar to a Sierra Nevada but a little better. Its only available in New York though.

This beer is exactly what I feel a lot of other beers try to be when they mix distinct flavors. This is equally spicy and sweet, but the flavors arent in competition with each other and it makes for a fantastic beer. This is probably the best winter ale Ive ever had that actively distinguishes itself from all other winter beers without going overboard and making some strange, gimmicky beer whose recipe will need to be altered every year.

I was stoked for this beer. What a cool concept, apricots and Dogfish Head, right? Eh. I didnt enjoy it like I thought I would. It wasnt a bad beer, but it didnt keep me drinking. It was a little bitter and not really smooth, and tasted more reminiscent of grapefruit than any other fruit flavor I can associate with a beer. Just okay.

I did not expect such a dark beer upon pouring. I was pleasantly surprised by the taste after seeing just how dark it is, because I feared it would be drowned in a coffee taste or something more bitter more typically associated with beers this dark, but it wasnt like that. The coffee notes were subtle, and worked nicely. Nothing really stood out beyond that, and it wasnt quite as smooth as I like, but it is a good beer. Is it worth the hefty price tag (something like $20 for a 750ml bottle)? No, I dont think it is.

This beer is so much cooler in theory than it is in execution. I got excited when I saw it because I love Two Roads, I love sours, and I love beers that are aged in other alcoholic barrels, but this beer is one with two conflicting flavors that are in competition with each other. You dont get the sour and you dont get the bourbon because the two effectively cancel each other out.
beer_name: Two Roads Conntucky Lightnin Bourbon Ale

review_blob: I thought this beer looked about a thousand times better than it ended up tasting. Its beauty is in its color and head, but thats it. I instantly forgot what it tasted like because its got nothing outstanding about it and while I would drink it again because it didnt suck, its just not a memorable beer.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Tank 7 Farmhouse Ale

review_blob: Im not as crazy about this IPA as I am about the Outta Focus. Its hoppier than I tend to like and its kind of bitter on the aftertaste, but its not awful.
This is a beer that tastes more like coffee than chocolate. Its good, but Im not a coffee drinker, so its not something I loved so much as I respectfully appreciated.
This was a good beer, but it wasnt very memorable. I know I drank it, but I couldnt tell you much more about it other than what color it was. Give it a try, but dont wait around for it.
This is a fun beer. I was excited to try it, and when I did, I wasnt blown away like I thought I might be, but it was worth sipping on in a flight and it wasnt bad in any way.
beer_name: Appalachian Trail Blaze Maple Brown Ale

review_blob: I love the smell of coffee and hate the taste of it. This beer is a pint of cold coffee in smell and in taste, and because its so strong on the coffee notes, its not palatable to someone like me. I can appreciate the craft here, but I cant drink this beer.
This is on the fruitier side of barleywines, and while it doesn't strike me as something I'd recommend to others to try the style, it's not a bad beer, and it's very smooth.
This is a solid hefeweizen. It didnt blow me away, but it was enjoyable and Id try it again, perhaps with the right food pairing. Its light in color and body and solid in taste.

This is a good IPA. I didnt think it was too hoppy or too bitter, and thats what I want out of an IPA. My girlfriend thought it was kind of standard as IPAs go, not really standing out, but I thought it was really easy to drink and very smooth.

This is the best sour Ive ever had. I joked that it tasted more like red wine than beer after each sip, but it really does combine the best of both very effectively. Its sweet and its sour and its easy to smell all the complex goings-on from the currants fermenting in the oak barrels. Id drink this again and again.

This is a good beer. Its kind of sweet for a lager, but it doesnt insult you with its odd approach to a lager. Its good! One thing I noticed is that it didnt keep particularly well, but I found that to be the case with the other beer I bought from ABC as well. It may be their packaging that doesnt last.

This is a good beer. Full bodied and full of flavor, it doesnt get in the way of what youre eating and its really smooth on the finish. After about a week in the fridge, though, it had lost significant head and carbonation. I was pretty bummed to see how it didnt keep very long.
The Ogden is dry. Its a good beer, but it doesnt shake you by the shoulders and its easily forgettable. I dont think I could go back weeks later and describe what it tastes like.

This is a good ass beer. Its not on par with Allagashs Curieux, but its a great bourbon aged beer. Its got a vanilla aftertaste, which is easy on the tastebuds, but not extremely pleasing because it kind of tastes out of place, but its a good product overall.
I dont like IPAs. I love this beer. Its not too hoppy, its crisp, its rich, and tastes less like an IPA than it does a slightly hoppy beer that anyone could enjoy.
This is a fantastic sour. Its got a great fruit cherry flavor, and its tart enough to remind you this is a gose style of beer and not some gimmicky drink. Get one!

This gose is sweet yet tart, just like it should be. Its not very strong, so its easy to drink a few of them at once, and its sour taste is a little more reminiscent of apple juice than of a sour beer, but its very good.
beer_name: Anderson Valley Highway 128 Blood Orange Gose

review_blob: This a light, refreshing beer. Its crisp and fruity, but it isnt too sweet. Its not particularly memorable, but its good! It toes the line between "fruit beer" and "carbonated fruity drink you consume by the pool," but there is enough "beer" flavor there to not write it off as a Mikes Hard Lemonade type drink.
This beer doesnt do anything in spectacular fashion, but its light, its easy on the eyes, and it sits well on the tongue. You can do a lot worse than this beer as summer ales go.
What a remarkably average beer! Drink this if theres nothing else around and you dont want to risk drinking something you know will taste like feet. But otherwise, pass this up.

Damnation is a very good Belgian ale that leans a little on the stronger side. Its a beer that lends itself more to a slow sip than a big chug or gulp, but its still smooth enough to not bite back after swallowing.

Not to be confused with its overrated counterpart everyone loves (Golden Monkey), sour monkey is a great gose with good flavor and the right balance of sour and sweet youd expect from a brewer like Victory.

I was pleased to find that this beer does indeed taste like watermelon, and not something with artificial "watermelon flavor" added for the sake of making it sweeter and more appealing, as happens with candy since watermelon itself is so boring. Its light in body and in color, and its easy to drink. Id recommend it to anyone who asked about it.
beer_name: 21st Amendment Hell or High Watermelon Wheat

review_blob: This beer is fantasticit tastes just like its advertised to taste, but its slightly on the sweet side to the point of being too sweet. Its not overwhelming if youre only drinking one or two at a time, but beyond that, its sweetness can become too much.
Tripel Perfection is just what I expectedgreat. It pits beautifully and tastes just as smooth as every other beer Ommegang has ever made. Definitely worth buying again.

Wow. This beer is like drinking champagne, beer, and sparkling wine all at once. The amount of carbonation is a little off-putting, but the taste is rich with raspberries and drinking it allows you to appreciate the process involved in making it. Really cool beer.

I dont really have any problems with this beer; it isnt offensive to any of my senses, but it doesnt stand out as anything spectacular, and given its niche style, it should be able to do that to be memorable. It pours with almost no head and doesnt sit smoothly before swallowing, but it smells great, otherwise looks good, and tastes solid enough to want to keep drinking it.

I dont like IPAs. I dont particularly like grapefruit. This beer, though, is tart yet fruity, strong, yet smooth. I dont have the palette to really appreciate everything about it, but I can taste it and know that this is a beer worthy of its acclaim.
Sofie is exactly what I expect from a saison. You can immediately taste the spices that youd expect from a saison, but its finish is so smooth that you know youre drinking something special.

I dont know what to say about this beer other than that its about as average as a beer could be. Not bad by any means, but it isnt special in any way and it doesnt have any qualities that jump out at you.

The Yards Saison is pretty to look at and smells just as nice, but its lacking something in taste. It doesnt taste badits quite enjoyable and its light in taste, but it also feels a little flat, like it cant quite distinguish itself from other saisons. Its still a solid beer from a very good company, and Id drink it again. I just dont love it.
This beer is easy on the eyes, but its not quite as easy on the tongue. I like the citrus flavors, but the hint of spiciness feels just a touch out of place. This isnt a bad beer, but its not great.
